page.title: 08PAPER DELIVERY IN EXETER.
page.content: The main local newspaper in Exeter is the Express and Echo. The paper boys and girls deliver the papers and get paid Â£2.80 a week. There are 6 paper girls and 5 boys altogether. The Express and Echo is delivered in the evening.The paper boys and girls have a plastic sheet in a plastic see- through cover. These things tell them which houses to deliver to. If a per son is away then the newspaper boys and girls turn over the strips so they know which ones not to deliver to These things are called Moonstrips. Most of the papers come from Fleet Street and are picked up by a van. The newspaper boys and girls dont usually go out of the area that they live in because it is too far to go and they would not know the roads well enough.
